Table of Contents

Novak Djokovic is a Serbian professional tennis player who dominated professional tennis by ranking number 1 for 373 weeks and finishing year-end number 1 seven times.

See the fact file below for more information on Novak Djokovic, or you can download our 23-page Novak Djokovic worksheet pack to utilize within the classroom or home environment.

Key Facts & Information

EARLY LIFE AND EDUCATION

On May 22, 1987, in Belgrade, Serbia, Yugoslavia, Novak Djokovic was born to Srdan and Dijana. His mother is from Croatia, and his father is from Serbia.

His family runs a tennis academy in addition to eateries. In addition to his father, uncle, and aunt being good skiers, Djokovic’s soccer-playing father was a high-level player.

He was first introduced to tennis when he was four years old.

He was discovered by the Serbian tennis player and coach, Jelena Genčić, in his parents’ fast food restaurant at Mount Kopaonik during the summer of 1993.

She was astounded by his superb performance for someone so young. She continued to train the rising talent until 1999.

Genčić arranged for him to practice with former Croatian tennis star Nikola Pili for his subsequent development.

The 12-year-old youngster spent four years at the Pili tennis academy in Oberschleißheim, Germany, after being transferred there in September 1999.

PROFESSIONAL CAREER

In 2003, Djokovic started his professional career. At the 2008 Australian Open, he defeated Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer to win his first major title, breaking their 11-match winning streak.

In the tournament’s Adelaide final in 2007, Djokovic triumphed over Chris Guccione. At the Australian Open, he was defeated by Roger Federer in the fourth round and went on to lose.

Nevertheless, he did well at the Master Series competitions in Key Biscayne and Indian Wells, finishing second (Champion).

His ranking among the top 10 athletes in the world was aided by these accomplishments.

After winning his maiden Master Series championship, Djokovic returned to Serbia to support the entry of his native nation into the Davis Cup World Group.

He was defeated by David Ferrer in the third round of the Monte Carlo Masters. He defeated Richard Gasquet in the Estoril Open championship match.

Rafael Nadal defeated him at the Internazionali d’Italia in Rome, while Carlos Moyà defeated him at the Hamburg Masters. At Wimbledon, he defeated Marcos Baghdatis in the quarterfinal.

By 2010, Djokovic had also distinguished himself from the competition, joining Federer and Nadal as part of the Big Three, who are regarded by some as the three greatest male tennis players of all time.

Djokovic achieved his first No. 1 ranking in 2011 after taking home three of the four major championships and five Masters titles.

For the remainder of the decade, he held the title of the most successful male tennis player, dominating the tour at major tournaments, the Masters, and the Year-End Championships.

Djokovic had his most successful year in 2015, making it to 15 straight finals and taking home a season-high 10 big titles, including three majors, six Masters events, and the Year-End Championships.

After battling an elbow injury in 2017, Djokovic won major tournaments at Wimbledon and the US Open in 20By winning the first three Grand Slams of the year, Djokovic kept up with Federer and Nadal in 2021, surpassing the milestone of 20 major titles won.18.

ACHIEVEMENTS

Twenty-one Grand Slam titles and seven consecutive years as the top player in the world belong to Djokovic. He held the top spot for an unprecedented 373 weeks.

Eight male players, which includes Djokovic, have completed the Career Grand Slam, and only four have completed the Double Career Grand Slam.

He is the only tennis player in history to simultaneously hold all four major championships on three different court surfaces.

He is the only player to have won at least twice in each of the nine ATP Masters 1000 competitions, the ATP Tour Finals, and all four majors.

Djokovic is frequently ranked alongside Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, collectively known as the Big Three, who have dominated Men’s tennis for almost 20 years, as one of the three best tennis players of all time.

He has played in every Grand Slam tournament’s final at least six times, setting an all-time record, and has advanced to a record 32 Grand Slam finals.

At the start of 2011, Djokovic was unbeatable, riding a 43-game winning streak during which he captured the Australian Open.

His winning streak ended when Federer defeated him in the French Open quarterfinals, but he quickly recovered by winning the US Open and Wimbledon, propelling him to the top of the rankings.

He has six ATP Tour Finals victories to his credit, including a record-setting run of four straight wins from 2012 to 2015.

LEGACY

One of the most accomplished tennis players in the world, Novak Djokovic, is well known.

Throughout his career, he maintained an impressive record and regularly showed his dedication to the game.

Djokovic has dedicated a lot of time to honing his accuracy, speed, and mental agility while practicing with famous instructors since tennis is in his blood.

These are the main factors that made this player’s legacy so great and why it will endure.

Novak Djokovic founded the Novak Djokovic Foundation in 2007 to provide underprivileged kids with safe, nurturing settings to grow up in and flourish.

The foundation and the World Bank joined up in August 2005 to support early childhood education in Serbia. The organization has already built over 40 schools, which has also helped over a thousand families and nearly 20,800 kids.

In order to assist underprivileged children, Djokovic gave $20,000 to Melbourne City Mission’s early childhood education program after winning the 2016 Australian Open.

He and his wife announced that they would donate €1 million to purchase ventilators and medical equipment to aid hospitals and other healthcare facilities during the COVID-19 outbreak.

PERSONAL LIFE

In high school, Djokovic met his future bride, Jelena Ristic, and they began dating in 2005. The couple became engaged in September 2013.

They married on July 10, 2014. A wedding at the Church of Saint Stephen followed on July 12, 2014. On April 24, 2014, before their marriage, the couple revealed they were expecting their first child.

Their son Stefan was born in France on October 21, 2014. The couple welcomed their daughter Tara into the world on September 2, 2017.

Frequently Asked Questions

Who is Novak Djokovic?

Novak Djokovic is a professional tennis player from Serbia. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest tennis players of all time and has achieved numerous records and accomplishments throughout his career.

What are some of Novak Djokovic’s major achievements in tennis?

Djokovic has won numerous Grand Slam titles, including multiple Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open championships. He has also held the world No. 1 ranking for extended periods and has completed several calendar-year Grand Slam bids, winning all four major championships in a single calendar year.

When did Novak Djokovic turn professional?

Novak Djokovic turned professional in 2003. He quickly rose through the ranks and gained prominence as one of the top players in men’s tennis.

What is Novak Djokovic’s playing style?

Djokovic is known for his exceptional all-around game. He is renowned for his incredible flexibility, defensive skills, agility, and strong return of serve. His ability to retrieve seemingly unreachable balls and turn defense into offense has earned him the nickname “The Djoker.”

What are some of Novak Djokovic’s rivalries in tennis?

Djokovic has had intense rivalries with other tennis legends such as Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer. These matchups have produced some of the most memorable and competitive matches in the sport’s history.
